title: John Bolton: Trump trying to set up con on his own supporters
description: CNN's Jake Tapper speaks with former national security adviser John Bolton about President Donald Trump's rhetoric around when mail-in ballots should be counted and Trump's threats of legal action after polls close on Election Day.

title: Watch this flying car complete its first flight
description: KleinVision's AirCar reached an altitude of 1500 feet and completed two take-offs and landings during its maiden flight in Slovakia, according to the company.

title: Nearly 50,000 Americans are hospitalized with coronavirus
description: The fall surge has left nearly 50,000 people hospitalized across the US due to Covid-19, and experts say the strain healthcare systems are under could soon get worse.

title: Trump tries to undermine democratic process at the end of the campaign
Whale of a ride: Crashed subway train lands on giant sea creature sculpture
description: A subway train in the Netherlands was saved from a spectacular crash when it burst through buffers and landed on an artwork in the shape of a whale tail.

title: Subway train lands on whale's tail statue
description: A subway train has crashed through a buffer stop and landed on a 30-foot-high whale statue near Rotterdam, Netherlands.

title: Here's what you need to know on election night
Archaeologists discover 300-year-old slave quarters that's almost entirely preserved
description: Archaeologist Julie Schablitsky knew her team was lucky.

title: Girl rescued alive after 65 hours trapped under rubble in earthquake
description: A three-year-old girl has been rescued alive from a collapsed apartment building in Izmir, Turkey, following Friday's strong earthquake, according to Turkish state news agency Anadolu.

title: Hurricane Eta expected to rapidly intensify over the next 24 hours and bring catastrophic conditions to Central America
description: Hurricane Tropical Storm Eta is expected to rapidly intensify over the next 24 hours as it churns in the Caribbean Sea toward Nicaragua, bringing with it devastating conditions, according to the National Hurricane Center (NHC).

title: Gunmen kill at least 10 students in attack on Kabul university
description: Gunmen attacked Kabul University's campus on Monday, killing at least 10 students and trading fire with security forces, a senior Afghan government source and witnesses said.

title: Trump suggests he might fire Fauci after election
description: President Donald Trump suggested to a Florida crowd he may fire Dr. Anthony Fauci after the election, escalating his feud with the nation's leading expert on infectious diseases and providing a window into a potential post-November 3 administration purge.

title: Lamar Jackson can't break Pittsburgh Steelers' undefeated streak in the NFL
description: Can anyone stop the Pittsburgh Steelers this season? Certainly not the Baltimore Ravens.

title: The US President casts doubt on the integrity of vote counting and threatens to deploy lawyers
description: Photos: America votes | Report voting issues | Road to 270

title: Vatican says Pope's comments on same-sex civil unions were taken out of context
description: The Vatican has sought to clarify Pope Francis' comments in support of same-sex civil unions, saying they were taken out of context and do not signal a change in doctrine.

title: Why wasn't the UK public told about Prince William's Covid diagnosis?
description: Sunday night's news that Prince William tested positive for coronavirus earlier this year has raised questions as to why the British public was not told that the second-in-line to the throne had been ill during the pandemic.

title: FBI investigating alleged harassment of Biden campaign bus by Trump supporters
description: The FBI is investigating the alleged harassment of a Joe Biden campaign bus last week by motorists displaying Trump 2020 flags.

title: Here's how NASA fared under Trump
description: President Donald Trump ignited a months-long political battle in 2017 when he appointed Jim Bridenstine, a Republican congressman from Oklahoma, to run NASA.

title: Notorious serial killer says he's surprised he wasn't caught sooner
description: A South Korean man admitted in court Monday that he murdered 14 women and girls three decades ago in one of the country's most notorious serial killing cases -- and said he was surprised he wasn't caught earlier.

title: Analysis: This could be the most important election of a lifetime
Trump blitzes must-win states with perfected rally routine
description: President Donald Trump was running late when he arrived here Sunday morning, wind howling and tiny drops of ice sticking to his face, to begin the second-to-last day of his final run for office.

title: Analysis: America needs an unequivocal verdict from voters
description: There is an unusual feeling of foreboding in America.

title: Chrissy Teigen honors late son with new tattoo
description: Chrissy Teigen revealed a tribute to the infant son she and husband John Legend lost.

title: Avlon calls out Trump's 'voter suppression strategy'
description: CNN's John Avlon describes the "dark history" of an alternative way to win an election.

title: 'I don't know if I'm going to be here next year': Lewis Hamilton says there are 'no guarantees' he will continue racing after 2020 season
description: On the brink of securing his seventh Formula 1 world title, Lewis Hamilton says there are "no guarantees" that he will continue racing after the 2020 season.

title: Edward Snowden says he will apply for Russian citizenship
description: Former US National Security Agency contractor Edward Snowden has announced that he and his wife are applying for Russian citizenship while also keeping their US nationalities.

title: Oil prices tumble as lockdowns stoke recession fears
description: Oil prices fell sharply on Monday as new lockdowns across Europe and record coronavirus cases in the United States slammed the outlook for energy demand.

title: Six 747s flew into a Dutch airport -- but then couldn't leave
description: Six Lufthansa Boeing 747-400s landed at Twente Airport, a small Dutch air hub in the northeast of the country, back in the summer -- but then were stranded for months.

title: Super typhoon Goni slams the Philippines
description: Goni brought catastrophic 195 mph winds to the Philippines. Gusts tore roofs from buildings and flood waters took over streets.

title: Opinion: The most important quality a president must have
description: This week, we ask the question: What comes next for America and the presidency? President Donald Trump upended countless longstanding norms when he took office, prompting Americans, foreign allies and enemies alike to wonder, what does the office of the presidency really stand for? In our CNN Digital video conversation, we'll discuss whether the American presidency has been transformed and redefined forever, but first we start with a prescription for its restoration, in a piece by David Gergen.

title: Johnny Depp loses libel case against Britain's Sun newspaper
description: Johnny Depp has lost his highly publicized libel case against the publisher of Britain's The Sun newspaper, whose claim that he was an abusive husband sparked a courtroom showdown between the Hollywood star and his ex-wife Amber Heard earlier this year.

title: The six states that could tip the election either way
description: President Trump won all six of these states in 2016, he'll need them again if he hopes to win a second term in the White House. CNN's John King gives his take on the road to 270.

title: Tanzania police arrest main opposition party leader ahead of protests
description: Tanzanian police have arrested Freeman Mbowe, the leader of the main opposition party Chadema, according to Tundu Lissu, the party's candidate in last week's presidential election.

title: Tens of thousands of protesters defy warning shots, stun grenades and arrests in Belarus
description: Riot police fired warning shots into the air, used stun grenades and arrested more than 200 people to deter tens of thousands of Belarusians who marched through Minsk on Sunday to demand veteran leader Alexander Lukashenko leave power.

title: In photos: The rodeos defying stereotypes about rural America
description: One of photographer Luke Gilford's earliest memories is of his father bringing him to the rodeo. The native Coloradan recalls a bold, colorful world of Stetson hats and snakeskin shoes, of barbecued meat and majestic horses.

title: Humans have been living on the space station for 20 years
description: When NASA astronaut William Shepherd and Russian cosmonauts Yuri Gidzenko and Sergei Krikalev entered the International Space Station on November 2, 2000, they became the first of many to live in the orbiting laboratory 227 nautical miles above Earth.

title: Robert Fisk, the journalist who interviewed bin Laden, dies at 74
description: Robert Fisk, the veteran Middle East correspondent, has died at the age of 74, according to his employer, The Independent newspaper.

title: How the US election might determine the future of travel
description: Airport improvements, easier access to certain destinations, making aviation less destructive ecologically -- and a railroad revolution.

title: In Egypt the mummies return. But will tourists in a pandemic?
description: Saqqara, a dusty necropolis south of Cairo, has become instrumental in Egypt's fightback against a tourist slump.

title: Sindika Dokolo, Congolese businessman and art collector, has died aged 48
description: Sindika Dokolo, the Congolese businessman and owner of one the world's most important African art collections, has died aged 48.

title: New Zealand's Jacinda Ardern appoints country's first Indigenous female foreign minister
description: New Zealand appointed its first Indigenous female foreign minister Monday to represent what's shaping up to be one of the most diverse parliaments in the world.

title: Rural public health workers say they feel 'hated.' Hear one resident's shocking response
description: Covid-19 is on the rise in rural America. CNN's Elle Reeve visits Carter County, Missouri, to speak with public health officials who have become unlikely villains to the town's residents.
